citation.article-title: Isolation and Characterization of Haloanaerobacter chitinovorans gen. nov., sp. nov., a Halophilic, Anaerobic, Chitinolytic Bacterium from a Solar Saltern.

p.s: Haloanaerobacter (Ha.lo.an.a.e.ro.bac'ter. Gr.n. halo, salt; Gr.pref. an, not; Gr.n. aer, air; M.L. masc. n. bacter, a rod or staff; M.L. fem. n. Haloanaerobacter, salt bacterium not living in air)
Cells are gram-negative, colorless, motile, nonsporulating rods; the cells are long and flexible in young cultures, and short degenerate cells occur in old cultures.
Surface colonies are opaque and glossy with entire edges.
Colony diameters range from 0.5 to 1.0 mm.
Agar-embedded colonies form large gas pockets.
Growth occurs at NaCl concentrations of 0.5 to 5 M; optimal growth occurs at an NaCl concentration of 2 to 3 M.
Obligate anaerobes; oxidase and catalase negative.
The major glucose fermentation products are CO2, H2, acetic acid, and isobutyric acid.
The type species is Haloanaerobacter chitinovorans sp. nov.
